summary: A hotkey program useful for Skyrim (not Skyrim SE) players but especially for those who install and test mods. It improves your workflow! See "SkyFlow Features" for more information.
descriptionHtml:
THIS IS AN OLD APPLICATION. But you might find it handy. [b][color=#cc0000][size=5]By default NOT compatible with Skyrim SE[/size][/color][/b] but you can make it so when you edit the Autohotkey script.


[size=4][b][color=red]Description[/color][/b][/size]

SkyFlow is a hotkey program useful for Skyrim players but especially for people who install and test mods. It improves your workflow! See "Features" for more information.

Tired of using Ctrl+Alt+Delete all the time when Skyrim freezes or crashes? Then this program will certainly be useful for you!


[size=3][b]SkyFlow Features:[/b][/size]

+ Instant terminate Skyrim (especially useful when your Skyrim freezes or crashes)

+ Minimize and maximize Skyrim quickly with hotkeys and without the mouse arrow bug.

+ Toggle Windows Aero on/off to free about 110 MB video card memory.

+ The Free Camera, Godmode, and HUD on/off toggle.

+ Binding your mouse thumb side buttons to whatever key you like.

+ Dual Cast magic with a single hotkey.

+ Activate your own customized batch cheat lists with hotkeys (useful for mod testing purposes).

+ Change timescale and run speed with hotkeys.

+ Start your game launcher executable with a hotkey.




[size=4][b][color=red]Update from version 2 to 3[/color][/b][/size]

1. Backup the SkyFlow_Settings.ini file to your desktop.

2. Uninstall SkyFlow 2.0 completely with the "SkyFlow_Uninstaller.bat"

3. Install SkyFlow 3.0


[size=4][b][color=red]Installation[/color][/b][/size]


1. Unzip the .zip file to your Skyrim folder. All files should be in the same folder where TESV.exe is located.


2. Open SkyFlow_Settings.ini from your Skyrim folder with [url=http://notepad-plus-plus.org/]Notepad++[/url] or another text editor. I really recommend using Notepad++.


3. (Optional) Change the "Game Launch Executable".

You can use any executable to launch Skyrim: SkyrimLauncher.exe (Default), skse_loader.exe (Skyrim Script Extender), SBW.exe (Skyrim Borderless Window). Don't use the launch Skyrim with hotkey when you use Mod Organizer.

[code]
[General]
Game_Launch_Executable = SkyrimLauncher.exe
[/code]


5. (Optional) Change the "SkyFlow Command Hotkey". This is the hotkey that should be pressed in combination with other keys.

[code]
[Hotkeys]
SkyFlow_Command = RCtrl
[/code]

6. (Optional) Now change the other INI settings if you would like to do so. But you might as well test SkyFlow before you do so.

7. Save and close SkyFlow_Settings.ini


8. Launch SkyFlow.exe from your Skyrim folder. Notice that SkyFlow appear in the taskbar tray as hidden program.

[color=red]Important:[/color] The SkyFlow.exe needs to run with admin rights enabled (right click SkyFlow.exe, then go to the compatibility tab).


[size=4][b][color=red]Uninstall[/color][/b][/size]

Run SkyFlow_Uninstaller.bat from your Skyrim folder. You might backup your SkyFlow INI settings file before you uninstall.


[size=4][b][color=red]Hotkeys (defaults)[/color][/b][/size]

[color=red]Important:[/color] Numlock needs to be on (notice a light indicator appear on your keyboard to show you that Numlock is on)

SkyFlow Command Key:
Right Ctrl

Toggle SkyFlow hotkeys On/Off:
Right Ctrl

Toggle Windows Aero On/Off:
SkyFlow Command + A

Minimize Skyrim:
SkyFlow Command + N

Maximize Skyrim:
SkyFlow Command + M

Reload SkyFlow INI settings:
SkyFlow Command + R

Launch Skyrim Launch Executable:
SkyFlow Command + L

Quit Skyrim:
SkyFlow Command + Q


Dual Cast:
Left Windows Key

Mouse Side Button 1 (MouseXButton1):
Empty

Mouse Side Button 2 (MouseXButton2):
Empty

The Free Camera:
Numpad 0

The God Mode:
Numpad Dot

Toggle HUD:
Numpad Enter

Custom Cheat Lists:

Cheat List 1 = Numpad 1
Cheat List 2 = Numpad 2
Cheat List 3 = Numpad 3
Cheat List 4 = Numpad 4
Cheat List 5 = Numpad 5
Cheat List 6 = Numpad 6
Cheat List 7 = Numpad 7
Cheat List 8 = Numpad 8
Cheat List 9 = Numpad 9

These custom batch cheat lists can be modified to your liking in the files "_c01.txt" to "_c09.txt".


Change timescale:

Default (20) = SkyFlow Command + 0
Fast (40) = SkyFlow Command + 1
Really Fast (400 and this might break your game) = SkyFlow Command + 2
Extreme (3500 and this might break your game) = SkyFlow Command + 3

These timescale batch cheat lists can be modified to your liking in the files "_t0.txt" to "_t3.txt".


Change running speed:

Default (100) = SkyFlow Command + 4
Fast (200) = SkyFlow Command + 5
Extreme (400) = SkyFlow Command + 6

These running speed batch cheat lists can be modified to your liking in the files "_rsdef.txt", "_rsfast.txt" and "_rsextr.txt".


[size=4][b][color=red]Recommendations[/color][/b][/size]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/1334]Mod Organizer[/url] - I think this the most useful mod manager for managing tons of (heavy) mods.

[size=4][b][color=red]Credits[/color][/b][/size]

Gantar
Autohotkey Development Team - [url=http://www.autohotkey.com]www.autohotkey.com[/url]

[size=5][color=green]Please endorse[/color] if you find this program useful. [/size]
author: Gantar
